title: s3-WGS

source.description:
Attached is a s3 molecular layout per step. As well as oligonucleotides used in the protocol. Prior to starting, iTSM plate should be prepared following the protocols listed within this step.
Tabs with oligonucleotides to be ordered and prepared:
  • iTSM sci_WG
  • A14_ME_LNA
  • PCR_i5 primers
  • PCR_i7 primers
For generation of Tn5 enzyme.

source.title: Generation and Purification of pTXB1.Tn5
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3jc4i","text":"Generation of Tn5 transposome, protein purification and loading for the sci- family of protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ir3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5r7l","text":"Protein purification of pTXB1.Tn5 transformed into T7 Express LysY (NEB C3031) cells; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bacga","text":"reference is PTXB1-Tn5 Addgene #60240 from Picelli et al. Genome Res. 2014.''","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"17k7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdogo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9p6c","text":"This protocol is built largely off of work described in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhlad","text":"Picelli, Simone, et al. \"Tn5 transposase and tagmentation procedures for massively scaled sequencing projects.\" Genome research 24.12 (2014): 2033-2040. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

For loading Tn5 enzyme.
  • Load only a single oligonucleotide + mosaic end reverse compliment oligonucleotide per well.
  • Load to a final concentration of equimolar 2.5uM oligonucleotide:mosaic end reverse compliment with 2.5uM Tn5.

source.title: Loading Tn5 Enzyme with sci-protocol Oligonucleotides

source.body: OPTIONAL: To prevent protease degradation, we also add 2 tables of Pierce Preotease Inhibitor Tablets, EDTA-Free to NIB following construction. We then vortex to fully dissolve tablets.
NIB is stable at for at least 1 month without noticable degradation in library quality or nuclei dissociation ability.

source.description: Different isolation techniques are h ighlighted across the s3 protocol family and can be used interchangeably for downstream processing. For s3WGS we primarliy used adherent cultured cell lines.

source.body:
Note
Isolation of nuclei is dependent on the sample being used. And optimization should be performed. Below is an example of a nuclei isolation protocol to act as general use for primary brain tissue samples. Other tissues should follow a similar dounce homogenization protocol.

source.description: Plate 1 million cells in T25 flask the day prior and harvest while cells are subconfluent.

and hold on ice.

Take aliquot of sample and dilute (10uL of nuclei suspension in
for a 1:10 dilution).

Determine nuclei/uL concentration of diluted aliquot through Hemocytometer or BioRad TC20 Automated Cell Counter using manufacturer's recommended protocols.
Adjust calculated concentration for the stock nuclei suspension.

Separate nuclei into 1 million nuclei aliquots and transfer into 5mL tubes.
Add volume of NIB:HEPES to suspend 1M nuclei aliquots in
.

source.body: We generally generate multiple replicates of the 1M nuclei aliquots. We have also done up to 3M nuclei aliquots without any change to protocol which performed the same.

source.body: Hold SBS12-U-ME TSM plate on ice while pipetting out. Also hold nuclei and tagmentation plate on ice until plate is fully prepared.

source.body: Shaking helps keep nuclei suspended during tagmentation.

source.description:
Place plate on ice following incubation and hold for
to allow reactions to drop temperature.

Pool the full plate while maintaining plate and pool on ice. Add
to pool. Hold pool on ice while preparing the PCR plate. Nuclei are stable on ice for several hours.

source.body: If there are any visible chunks in pool, strain again through 40um cell strainer.

source.description:
Prepare a 96 well plate with
per well , diluted with ddH2O.

From the DAPI stained pool, sort 15 nuclei per well mimicking the above nuclei gating strategy. If possible, hold the sample chamber and pool at
in your sorter settings.

source.body: The number of nuclei per well for PCR is determined by the number of uniquely indexed transposases going into tagmentation. For 96 reactions (a single iTSM plate), it has been emperically deteremined to be 15 nuclei per well based on a 5% barnyard collision rate.

source.body: It is crucial to dd 0.1% SDS and NPM in step-wise fashion and not pre-combined. High SDS concentration will disrupt polymerases in NPM.

source.body: PCR takes between 15-17 cycles. Use SYBR fluoresence to guide when to pull libraries. Once fluoresence stops exponential growth, the libraries are ready to hold at 72C and then remove.

source.description:
Pool post-PCR Product
Pool 25 uL from each well into 15mL conical tube.

Concentrate DNA via column clean up
Run full pool volume through Qiaquick PCR purification column following manufacturer's protocol.
Elute in
.

source.title: Qiagen QIAquick PCR Purification Kit Protocol
source.title_html: Qiagen QIAquick PCR Purification Kit Protocol
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"58prk","text":"This protocol is designed to purify single- or double-stranded DNA fragments from PCR and other enzymatic reactions (see page 8). For cleanup of other enzymatic reactions, follow the protocol as described for PCR samples or use the MinElute Reaction Cleanup Kit. Fragments ranging from 100 bp to 10 kb are purified from primers, nucleotides, polymerases, and salts using QIAquick spin columns in a microcentrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Clean by size selection with SPRI beads
Perform a 1X SPRI bead size selection (selecting for DNA > 200 bp).

Qubit DNA HS Quantification
Quantify DNA concentration with 1uL eluted sample on Qubit DNA High-sensitivity kit following manufacturer's protocol.

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aetdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Agilent Tapestation 4150 Quantification
Dilute sample to 2 ng/uL based on read out of Qubit by addition of 10mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0.
Run 2 uL sample on Agilent Tapestation 4150 DNA High Sensitivity D5000 or D1000 following manufacturer's protocol.

Use Tapestation software to quantify DNA from 200-1000bp size.
Dilute library to 1nM and prepare for sequencing following Illumina protocols.

Load libraries according to standard loading concentrations suggested by Illumina with the following cycle counts per read. Sequencing is standard chemistry.

source.body: If there is significant clumping, nuclei can bed loosed by a 10 min incubation in NIB:Tris and then triturated. If this does not work, loose strokes (B) on a douce homogenizer works as well.

source.description:
Take aliquot of sample and dilute (5uL of nuclei suspension in
for a 1:10 dilution).

Determine nuclei/uL concentration of diluted aliquot through Hemocytometer or BioRad TC20 Automated Cell Counter using manufacturer's recommended protocols.
Adjust calculated concentration for the stock nuclei suspension.
Dilute nuclei to 500 nuclei/uL with NIB:Tris for aliquoting out to tagmentation plate.

materials.name: TrypLE™ Express Enzyme (1X), no phenol red
Pierce™ Protease Inhibitor Mini Tablets, EDTA-free
Thermo Scientific™ Nalgene™ Rapid-Flow™ Sterile Disposable Filter Units with PES Membrane

description:
s3WGS (symmetrical strand single-cell combinatorial indexing; whole genome sequencing) protocol for the capture of genomic reads in single-cells.
See https://mulqueenr.github.io/scwgs/ for more information.
